Key Arguments: Truth is not a static concept and cannot be definitively defined.
Freedom of expression is essential for democracy and the exploration of truth.
The government should not have the power to define or control truth.
Historical examples show that government-held truths can be incorrect.
The proposed legislation could stifle debate and hinder the evolution of truth.
Notable Quotes: Truth is an exploration. It is not a static single point.
A democracy can only exist if freedom of expression exists.
The government does not hold a monopoly on truth.
This bill will lead to a static position on truth, eventually creating the very thing it claims to solve.
